poker

Class HandOfCards

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.HandOfCards

  • public class HandOfCards
extends java.lang.Object
    A standard hand of playing cards. The size of the hand is given by HAND_SIZE. The class contains an ArrayList of playing cards and a reference to the deck that cards are dealt from. The class contains functionality for sorting the hand based on card value, determining the best type of poker hand that can be formed, assigning a score to the hand and calculating a discard probability for a card in the hand.
    Author:
    Dara Callinan, Jazheel Luna, Eoghan O'Donnell, Crischelle Pana

      • getGameValue

        public int getGameValue()
        Calculates the game value for the hand. This value is calculated by determining the type of the hand and relating that to a constant amount. Then depending on the hand type, value is added based on the values of the cards in various ways. The value is constructed such that a better type of hand will always have a higher game value than a lower type of hand, and individual cards are weighted such that the largest groups of cards are weighted highest and cards are weighted in order of decreasing game value, as in standard poker rules.
        Returns:
        An int, the game value of the hand.

      • getDiscardProbHighHand

        private int getDiscardProbHighHand(int cardPos)
        Calculates the discard probability for a card at the specified position in a high hand.
        Parameters:
        cardPos - The position of the card to check.
        Returns:
        An int representing the probability of discarding the card.

      • getDiscardProbStraight

        private int getDiscardProbStraight(int cardPos)
        Calculates the discard probability for a card at the specified position in a straight. This will always be zero unless a flush can be made, as it is too difficult to make any other higher value hands.
        Parameters:
        cardPos - The position of the card to check.
        Returns:
        An int representing the probability of discarding the card.
        See Also:
        getDiscardProbability(int)

      • getDiscardProbFlush

        private int getDiscardProbFlush(int cardPos)
        Calculates the discard probability for a card at the specified position in a flush. Can return a small non-zero chance if a straight flush can be made.
        Parameters:
        cardPos - The position of the card to check.
        Returns:
        An int representing the probability of discarding the card.
        See Also:
        getDiscardProbability(int)

      • getDiscardProbFourOfAKind

      • getDiscardProbability

        public int getDiscardProbability(int cardPosition)
        Calculates an integer in the range 0 - 100 which represents the probability of a player discarding the card at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        cardPosition - The position of the card to check.
        Returns:
        The probability of discarding the card at this position.

      • discard

        public void discard(int[] indices,
                    int amountToDiscard)
        Returns cards at the specified indices to the deck, and deals new cards to replace them. Sorts the hand once the cards have been dealt.
        Parameters:
        indices - An array of positions of the cards in the hand to be discarded.
        amountToDiscard - The amount of cards to be discarded.
